topics.title: Pedestrian Crossings
topics.description: Recognising crossing types and giving safe priority to people crossing the road.

topics.title: Signals and Junction Control
topics.description: Reading traffic lights and controlled junction phases with safe decision timing.

topics.title: Bus Lane Rules
topics.description: Understanding bus lane signs, operating times, and safe lane discipline.

topics.title: Roundabouts
topics.description: Approach speed, lane choice, signalling, and exit planning for roundabouts.

topics.title: Speed Limits and School Zones
topics.description: Applying advisory and posted limits near schools and high-risk areas.

topics.title: Hazard Awareness
topics.description: Spotting developing risks early and adjusting speed and position.

topics.title: Mirror-Signal-Manoeuvre
topics.description: Planning safe manoeuvres with mirror checks, signalling, and control.

topics.title: Lane Positioning
topics.description: Choosing a stable lane position for visibility, safety, and flow.

topics.title: Stopping Distances
topics.description: Managing following distance and emergency stopping space.

topics.title: Weather and Night Driving
topics.description: Adjusting technique for rain, glare, darkness, and reduced grip.

topics.title: Motorway Basics
topics.description: Joining, lane use, speed management, and safe overtaking on faster roads.

topics.title: Parking and Reversing
topics.description: Low-speed control, observation, and safe positioning while parking.

lessons.title: Pedestrian Crossings: Lesson 1
lessons.content: This lesson covers practical, legal, and safety fundamentals for pedestrian crossings in everyday UK driving. Keep attention on live signs and road conditions.
keyPoints: Scan early and identify key cues.
Adjust speed before the hazard point.
Keep decisions smooth and predictable.

questions.prompt: For pedestrian crossings, what is the safest first action in scenario

options.text: Scan early, ease speed, and prepare a clear plan.
Hold speed and react only when very close.
Rely on drivers behind to create safe space.
Prioritise progress even if visibility is limited.

questions.explanation: Early observation and planned speed control reduce risk and keep the manoeuvre stable in pedestrian crossings situations.
